title: Permits the use of low speed electric vehicles only on roadways with a posted speed limit of not more than thirty-five miles per hour
summary: Permits the use of low speed electric vehicles only on roadways with a posted speed limit of not more than thirty-five miles per hour.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2704

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 20, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. RABBITT -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation  to  permitting
         the use of low speed electric vehicles on highways with a posted speed
         limit of not more than thirty-five miles per hour

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 121-f of the vehicle and traffic law, as amended by
    2  chapter 698 of the laws of 2006, is amended to read as follows:
    3    S 121-f. Low speed vehicle. 1. A limited use automobile  which  has  a
    4  maximum  performance speed of greater than twenty miles an hour, but not
    5  greater than twenty-five miles an hour or a truck which  has  a  maximum
    6  performance  speed of greater than twenty miles an hour, but not greater
    7  than twenty-five miles an hour and whose  gross  vehicle  weight  rating
    8  (GVWR)  is  less  than  three  thousand  pounds. All such vehicles shall
    9  comply with the safety standards established in 49 C.F.R. 571.500.
   10    2. LOW SPEED VEHICLES SHALL ONLY BE OPERATED ON PUBLIC HIGHWAYS  WHERE
   11  THE  POSTED  SPEED  LIMIT IS NOT MORE THAN THIRTY-FIVE MILES PER HOUR. A
   12  LOW SPEED VEHICLE MAY CROSS A PUBLIC HIGHWAY WITH A POSTED  SPEED  LIMIT
   13  IN  EXCESS  OF  THIRTY-FIVE MILES PER HOUR WHERE SUCH HIGHWAY INTERSECTS
   14  WITH A HIGHWAY WITH A POSTED SPEED LIMIT OF THIRTY-FIVE MILES  PER  HOUR
   15  OR  LESS.  THE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION MAY PROHIBIT LOW SPEED VEHI-
   16  CLES FROM DESIGNATED HIGHWAYS.
   17    S 2.  Nothing in this act shall be deemed to limit the authority of  a
   18  county,  city,  town or village from adopting or amending a local law or
   19  ordinance which prohibits the operation of low speed vehicles on  public
   20  highways  located in such county, city, town or village, so long as such
   21  local law or ordinance is consistent with its authority to  protect  the
   22  order, conduct, health, safety and general welfare of persons or proper-
   23  ty.    Nothing  in  this  act shall be deemed to alter or invalidate any

    3    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
    4  it shall have become a law.  Effective immediately, the amendment, addi-
    5  tion  and/or  repeal  of any rule or regulation necessary for the timely
    6  implementation of this act upon its effective date is hereby  authorized
    7  to be made on or before such effective date.
